block.p: Bill Croasdale, one of the best-known national broadcast television media buyers, is leaving his position as a consultant to Lou Schultz, chairman and chief executive at Initiative Media North America in Los Angeles, part of the Initiative Media Worldwide unit of the Interpublic Group of Companies.

Bruce Silverman, executive vice president and general manager at the Los Angeles office, confirmed a report in the online edition of Adweek, adding that no one was going to succeed Mr. Croasdale in his consulting capacity. ''He's irreplaceable,'' Mr. Silverman said.

Bill Croasdale, one of the best-known national broadcast television media buyers, is leaving his position as a consultant to Lou Schultz, chairman and chief executive at Initiative Media North America in Los Angeles, part of the Initiative Media Worldwide unit of the Interpublic Group of Companies.

Bruce Silverman, executive vice president and general manager at the Los Angeles office, confirmed a report in the online edition of Adweek, adding that no one was going to succeed Mr. Croasdale in his consulting capacity. ''He's irreplaceable,'' Mr. Silverman said.

Mr. Croasdale, 64, plans to consult for a sports marketing company in San Diego that one of his sons is opening. ''It's every father's dream to work with one of his children,'' Mr. Croasdale said. ''That's the only reason I'm leaving.''
